image.altText: A close up of a snake

props.synopsis: Experts say snake bite victims may not even be aware their lives are in imminent danger after a woman was killed by a snake in Katherine earlier this month.

title.children: Katherine snake bite death sparks warning against complacency

image.altText: A large LNG tank sits among mangrove trees, Darwin's skyline is visible in the background

props.synopsis: Secrecy around a major methane leak helped Santos avoid public scrutiny for years. It backfired after a prospective bidder reportedly found out via an ABC News report.

title.children: Secrecy over gas leak backfires as $36b Santos takeover scuttled

image.altText: A white woman, short blonde hair, wearing glasses, white blazer and blue top. Standing in front of blurred green background

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's attorney-general is facing backlash after failing to publicly declare a potential conflict of interest regarding a fatal hit-and-run driver before court.

title.children: Conflict of interest claims over attorney-general's link to hit-run driver

image.altText: close up sign of Optus

props.synopsis: Three people have died, including an eight-week-old baby, after a technical failure impacted hundreds of triple-0 calls on the Optus network.

title.children: Three people died after Optus network failure impacted triple-0 calls

image.altText: An exterior photo of Palmerston Regional Hospital which also shows the red entry to the ED.

props.synopsis: Large sections of flooring at the Northern Territory's newest, multi-million-dollar hospital are having to be ripped up and replaced after the facility failed food safety checks.

title.children: Flooring ripped up at the NT's newest multi-million-dollar hospital

image.altText: An older Indigenous man sits in front of colourful artworks in a gallery.

props.synopsis: For 25 years Bindi Mwerre Anthurre Artists has been helping people with a disability to communicate through creativity.

title.children: Art program celebrates 25 years with Alice Springs exhibition

image.altText: A police car parked outside of a home, with red and white tape cordoning off the front gate.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police have charged a 32-year-old man with the murder of his 31-year-old partner, who died hours after she was found unresponsive in the front yard of a Palmerston home earlier this week.

title.children: NT police charge man with partner's domestic violence murder

image.altText: A TV still of Miranda Tapsell, an Aboriginal woman in her late 30s, standing, holding her bag, at a remote art centre.

props.synopsis: Miranda Tapsell and Gwilym Lee return to their characters from the hit movie, Top End Wedding, to take on parenthood in the TV series, Top End Bub.

title.children: Miranda Tapsell's new show re-imagines what family can look like

image.altText: Steve Pountney and his family living in a bus in bushland in Perth's south-east 2025-08-20 08:08:00

props.synopsis: A Perth man who has been sleeping rough in a bus with his family for the past three years wonders if he would be better off with a roof over his head and regular meals in jail.

title.children: 'Don't throw your camping gear out': Family living in bus losing hope

image.altText: Donald and Melania walking on the tarmac at the airport

props.synopsis: The UN's role in areas beyond diplomacy, such as in humanitarian aid and refugees, cultural heritage, health, and climate, are all under assault from savage budget cuts.

title.children: UN meeting will test whether the world is at Donald Trump's mercy

image.altText: Andrew Bragg

props.synopsis: As questions mount about how Australia's retirement funds industry is regulated, a senator says regulator ASIC must more quickly and forcefully enforce the law.

title.children: Senator calls for 'heads on spikes' to deter super mismanagement

image.altText: Luke Kemp composite image with the painting 'Destruction', depicting the societal collapse of an empire.

props.synopsis: Lethal heat, mosquito-borne viruses, mass displacement and conflict — we got a glimpse into a grim climate future. Can imagining the end of the world be good for us, or is it a path to apathy?

title.children: 'Dr Doom' researches societal collapse, here's why he's a 'happy happy dog'

image.altText: Donald Trump King Charles troop inspection state visit

props.synopsis: Britain rolled the dice on an historic second state visit for the US president in a year of domestic and international political turmoil. It found out where its relationship with Washington was at.

title.children: Trump told to 'watch the sword' but Starmer had another concern

image.altText: A group of five Afghan girls stand smiling in the grass.

props.synopsis: After fleeing Afghanistan, many refugees in Pakistan are at risk of being deported back amid a crackdown on temporary card holders as they wait for humanitarian visas from Australia.

title.children: Afghans in Pakistan caught between Australia's delays and local crackdown

image.altText: Jimmy Kimmel waving while wearing a suit on a red carpet.

props.synopsis: The ABC has received hundreds of complaints about US talk show Jimmy Kimmel Live! being pulled off air and threats to boycott sponsors ... but that's the problem when two broadcasters from different countries share a name!

title.children: Confused complaints to ABC Australia reveal anger over Jimmy Kimmel

image.altText: Children sitting on the floor eat meals from silver trays.

props.synopsis: Over 800 students fall sick in two cases of mass food poisoning in one week after consuming free school meals sponsored by the Indonesian government.

title.children: Indonesian students suffer mass food poisoning from free school meals

image.altText: Donald Trump looking up and to the right, wearing a suit, at a press conference lectern.

props.synopsis: The US president's $US15 billion defamation lawsuit against The New York Times has been labelled "improper" by a federal judge.

title.children: Judge throws out Trump's New York Times lawsuit

image.altText: A Commonwealth Bank branch in Melbourne's CBD

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth Bank originally estimated the planned maintenance would mean some features would be unavailable until about 9am AEST — but it took longer than expected.

title.children: Why was CommBank down this morning?

image.altText: Jess Hull flicks her hair

props.synopsis: Jess Hull was concerned that a focus on the 800m was potentially hurting her endurance. Instead, her "side quest" could lead to a second world championship medal.

title.children: How Jess Hull's 'side quest' could lead to even greater glory

image.altText: A man with blonde hair in a suit shakes hand with a man with black hair in a suit

props.synopsis: The deal would transfer TikTok's US assets to US owners from ByteDance, according to sources familiar with the deal.

title.children: Trump says China's Xi approved TikTok deal

image.altText: Wreckage of MH17

props.synopsis: Moscow's appeal submitted to the International Court of Justice contested ICAO's decision "on all grounds".

title.children: Russia appeals decision blaming it for downing MH17 in 2014

image.altText: British couple released from detention by Taliban arrive in Doha

props.synopsis: The couple, who ran a charity in Afghanistan where they had lived for 18 years, were freed after months of negotiations with the Taliban by Qatar in coordination with Britain.

title.children: British couple freed from Afghanistan's Taliban

image.altText: Nick Daicos tackled by two Brisbane players

props.synopsis: The 2023 grand final will go down as one of the best deciders in AFL history, and though the stakes are only marginally lower two years on, the numbers suggest Collingwood and Brisbane's 2025 preliminary final could be another classic.

title.children: Two years on from a legendary grand final, Pies and Lions shape for dream rematch

image.altText: A well dressed elderly man in brown suit, hat and bowtie holds pipe in mouth with left hand and stares out to a river.

props.synopsis: Victor Caulfield packed up his Australian home and moved to Italy, where he fell into the art scene as an accidental model.

title.children: Life after divorce for this man meant moving to Florence in his 70s

image.altText: Students walk through the Great Court at the University of Queensland.

props.synopsis: Australia's universities are blighted by a "culture of consequence-free, rotten failure", a senate inquiry has found.

title.children: 'Rotten' Australian university culture lashed in long-running senate inquiry

image.altText: NSW Police Commissioner Karn Webb salutes officers at her farewell at the nsw police academy.

props.synopsis: The looming decision on who will be the next NSW police commissioner may be one of the biggest of Chris Minns's tenure.

title.children: The contenders vying to replace outgoing NSW police commissioner

image.altText: A upside down car and shrapnel in an old black and white photo

props.synopsis: Half a century after the Kianga mine explosion killed 13 workers in central Queensland, a community gathers to remember the tragedy as survivors and experts raise fresh concerns about ongoing safety risks.

title.children: Deadly disaster's aftermath echoes 50 years on amid new safety concerns

image.altText: For sale sign on Queenslander-style house that needs renovating in a street in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Solicitors are charging anywhere from $300 up to $1,000 to help fill out a form required under the state's new laws, according to a Brisbane buyer's agent and law expert.

title.children: New Queensland property laws bring transparency — but at a cost for sellers

image.altText: The four members of Pink Floyd pose for a publicity photo outside.

props.synopsis: Pink Floyd looked to the past to find a way forward after the massive success of Dark Side Of The Moon in 1973. The result was Wish You Were Here, released 50 years ago this week.

title.children: Pink Floyd's ode to Syd Barrett, Wish You Were Here, turns 50

image.altText: A large fern in a shop

props.synopsis: Thousands of native tree ferns are harvested from Tasmania's forests for export each year. Some say the trade saves ferns from destruction, while others accuse the industry of greenwashing.

title.children: Why Tasmanian ferns hundreds of years old are on sale in UK garden centres

image.altText: Chelsea FC Women star Sam Kerr stands on the pitch smiling widely after a win.

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr is honoured with a special football to mark her 100 goals for Chelsea — and she can't stop smiling since the landmark strike.

title.children: 'Like a new person': Sam Kerr all smiles after comeback goal

image.altText: F1 driver Oscar Piastri standing on the winner's step of the podium with a gold medal around his neck

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri returns to the streets of Baku — one year on from a terrific victory — holding a 31-point lead in the Formula 1 drivers' championship.

title.children: How to watch Oscar Piastri race this weekend's Azerbaijan Grand Prix

image.altText: Ten Formula 1 cars snake around a bend on a track on a rainy day near a full grandstand

props.synopsis: As general admission ticket prices for the Melbourne Grand Prix accelerate past other marquee sport events, fans are questioning whether the growing expense is worth it.

title.children: 'Ridiculous': Formula 1 fans say Melbourne event is unaffordable

image.altText: A tray of just-baked sticky chicken wings on a tray, sprinkled with chopped parsley and ready for serving.

props.synopsis: It’s easy to make these irresistibly sticky wings that will have you licking your fingers and reaching for more.

title.children: One-tray honey chicken wings are an easy family dinner
